intro: Diploclisia chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese starfruit vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by fleshy, star-shaped fruits. Its botanical features include a woody stem and stipulate leaves, which are typical of the genus Diploclisia. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some regions.
